questions.text: A surgical team is discussing the use of STERRAD, a gas plasma sterilizer, in their operation theater for disinfecting surgical instruments. The process works by EtO combining with cell proteins to achieve sterilization. Despite its effectiveness, EtO poses significant safety risks as it is highly inflammable, irritant, explosive , and carcinogenic . To mitigate these risks, it is typically supplied in a concentration of 10% to 20% mixed with inert gases . The sterilization conditions for EtO involve a concentration of 700 mg/liter and 40–80% relative humidity. Sterilization is achieved within 4–5 hours at 38°C or 1 hour at 55°C.
